fact: The player must start the quest by speaking to Alonzo in Byzantium's Bureau of Exploration.
Alonzo explains that the tour is conducted by going around Halcyon and activating a series of beacons,
and returning to the Bureau of Exploration to claim a hat as a reward.
the first of which lies somewhere in Byzantium.
The first beacon is located in Byzantium,
on some grass in front of a building just outside the Bureau of Exploration.
The player can simply hop over the low fence and activate the beacon.
The second beacon has activated,
and appears to be in Emerald Vale,
somewhere far to the north of the Edgewater landing pad.
The second beacon is located on Terra 2, north of Edgewater, near the lava.
There are a number of Primals in this region which the player must get past to activate the beacon.
The third beacon has activated,
and appears to be on Scylla.
The third beacon is located on Scylla, near the landing pad.
There may also be marauders along the route,
particularly if the quest Solution Vital has not been completed.
The beacon is a few meters outside of the force field that provides an atmosphere for Scylla,
and normally the player would die before successfully activating the beacon and stepping back inside the force field.
However, if the player uses consumables to increase base health and movement speed and decrease harmful effects,
it can be possible to enter tactical time dilation,
step through the force field, activate the beacon,
and step back into the force field.
The fourth beacon has activated,
and appears to be on Monarch.
The fourth beacon is on Monarch,
near the edge of the "river" near the UDL lab.
As is the case for most of Monarch,
the area may be frequented by packs of canids, marauders, raptidons, or mantisaurs.
You've found all the beacons for the treasure hunt.
Return to Alonzo to get your prize.
After the player has activated the fourth beacon,
they can eturn to Alonzo and speak with him to find out the tour is fake, and was shut down long ago by The Board.
Alonzo will then admit that they did not expect the player to survive,
and had been using the beacon to record footage of mercenaries dying gruesomely to sell on Byzantium.
However, Alonzo will reluctantly give the player the Certified Explorer's Hat,
as promised.
Alonzo Vallejos works at the Bureau of Exploration in Byzantium.
He has set up a fake sightseeing tour of Halcyon,
with the goal of recording footage of mercenaries dying gruesome deaths,
then selling them for a large profit in Byzantium.
Byzantium is the capital city of Terra 2 and the crown jewel of Halcyon.
All the opulence, elegance, and decadence of the colony is concentrated in the city.
Its residents are colloquially referred to as gold-bloods.
Referred to as the "gilded city of the well-to-do",
Byzantium is where every Halcyon colonist wishes they could live.
The city is closed off to those without the means to be appropriate residents;
itâ€™s a literal gated community with secrets that lesser company workers will simply never learn.
The city of Byzantium was built in a radial layout,
with streets and docking bays encircling the Halcyon Holdings Corporation headquarters,
located in the restricted Acropolis District.
Many buildings constructed in Byzantium are well-maintained,
and are built in a futuristic Art Nouveau style,
as opposed to the simpler prefabricated frontier designs of Edgewater or Stellar Bay.
The Acropolis District is a wealthy district for the most prominent citizens of both Byzantium and the entire Halcyon Colony.
Located here are the headquarters of the Halcyon Holdings Corporation,
housed inside a towering skyscraper.
Docking bays for various vessels and ships have been constructed into a large, deep trench encircling the mid-section of Byzantium.
Only those individuals with the appropriate navkey are allowed to land on Byzantium's docking bays.
A district bordering the Acropolis District,
the Estate District is known as the residence of Minister Clarke.
Prosperity Plaza is the beating hub of commerce and culture in Byzantium,
fronted by famous establishments such as Bijou's Revue, Rococo's Decor, and Billingsly's House of Inebriation.
At the center of the plaza is a large decorative orrery in the likeness of the Halcyon system.
The Halcyon Holdings Corporate Board, also simply known as The Board,
institutes policy and law throughout the Halcyon Colony.
The details surrounding the board's founding remain largely unknown,
though its activities suggest that it was originally founded some seventy-odd years ago, give or take.
In that time, it has managed to terraform Terra I
(a catastrophic failure due to mutations rendering the wildlife overwhelmingly hostile to human life).
The Board maintains a very tense relationship with MSI, owing to MSI's democratic ideals and their declared ownership of Monarch.

As a result, the Board has placed Monarch, and by extension, MSI, under the Hazard Clause, which forbids off-world businesses from doing transactions on Monarch without the correct (and deliberately impossible to complete) documents.
Depending on the actions of the Stranger, MSI may be compelled to rebel against the Board's authoritarianism.
